newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway stock index drops, but banks shine.
newsitem.headline: Norway stock index drops, but banks shine.

text.p: Norwegian shares ended lower on Thursday following a strong opening boosted by appreciating banking sector stock.

Oslo's Total share index reached an intra-trade high of 1,276.60 points but conglomerate Norsk Hydro and other heavyweight industrial groups fell in the afternoon to burden the bourse. It finished 0.22 percent off at 1,269.04 points in good turnover of 1.20 billion crowns.
Hydro, the most traded company at 144 million crowns. closed one percent, or four crowns, lower at 397 crowns.
Shares in Den norske Bank (DnB), Norway's largest bank, jumped nearly three percent, or 0.90 crowns, to 31.50 crowns. It was the third most traded share at 91 million crowns.
"It could be that we are seeing a reappraisal of the whole sector in view of the Bavarian merger," one dealer said.

Germany's Bayerische Vereinsbank AG and Bayerische Hypotheken- und Wechsel-Bank AG announced on Monday they will merge. "Norwegian bank shares are still cheap by international comparison," the dealer said.
Christiania Bank og Kreditkasse, Norway's second largest bank, finished 1.14 percent up 26.70 crowns, a rise of 0.30 crowns. --Rolf Soderlind, Oslo newsroom +47 22 42 50 41
